https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number (GLN) is the GS1 Identification Key used to identify physical locations or parties. The key comprises a GS1 Company Prefix, Location Reference and Check Digit. For more information, see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

https://schema.org/PostalAddress.title: Postal Address
https://schema.org/PostalAddress.description: The location at which a particular organization or person may be found or reached.

https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.title: Organization Name
https://gs1.org/voc/organizationName.description: The name of the organization expressed in text.

https://schema.org/streetAddress.title: Street Address
https://schema.org/streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building.

https://schema.org/addressLocality.title: Address Locality
https://schema.org/addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality; for example, a city.

https://schema.org/addressRegion.title: Address Region
https://schema.org/addressRegion.description: Text specifying a province or state in abbreviated format; for example, NJ.

https://schema.org/addressCountry.title: Address Country
https://schema.org/addressCountry.description: Code specifying the country (and country subdivision) for the address using ISO 3166-1.

https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.title: Cross Street
https://gs1.org/voc/crossStreet.description: A street intersecting a main street (usually at right angles) and continuing on both sides of it.

https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.title: County Code
https://gs1.org/voc/countyCode.description: A code that identifies a county. A county is a territorial division in some countries, forming the chief unit of local administration. In the US, a county is a political and administrative division of a state.

https://schema.org/postalCode.title: Postal Code
https://schema.org/postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address.

https://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.title: Post Office Box Number
https://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The number that identifies a PO box. A PO box is a box in a post office or other postal service location assigned to an organization where postal items may be kept.

https://dlt.mobi/mobility-schema#Product.title: Product Registration Evidence Document
https://dlt.mobi/mobility-schema#Product.description: Evidence data for a registered eCommerce Product

https://schema.org/category.title: A category for the product item.

https://schema.org/inProductGroupWithID.title: Indicates the productGroupID for a ProductGroup

https://schema.org/releaseDate.title: Release date of a product or product model

https://schema.org/manufacturer.title: Manufacturer name or brand of the product

https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number of the manufacturer issued by GS1 (required), for more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

https://schema.org/leiCode.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
https://schema.org/leiCode.description: A Legal Entity Identifier of the manufacturer issued by GLEIF (required), for more information see https://gleif.org

https://schema.org/material.title: Material the product is made from

schema.title: Product Registration Evidence Document
schema.description: Evidence data for a registered eCommerce Product

category.title: A category for the product item.
examples: Example Product Category (required)

inProductGroupWithID.title: Indicates the productGroupID for a ProductGroup
examples: valid Product Group ID number per schema.org, could be NULL (required)

productID.title: Product ID
examples: Product number of registering Legal Entity such as an ISBN (required)

mpn.title: Manufacturer Part Number (MPN)
examples: Manufacturer part number (required)

gtin.title: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN)
examples: valid GTIN as number or URL per GS1 spec (required)

isAccessoryOrSparePartFor.title: Is accessory or sparepart for
examples: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part; may be empty (required)

releaseDate.title: Release date of a product or product model
examples: date when product (version) was first released (required)

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer name or brand of the product
examples: name of the manufacturer (required)

globalLocationNumber.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
globalLocationNumber.description: A Global Location Number of the manufacturer issued by GS1 (required), for more information see http://www.gs1.org/gln.

leiCode.title: Global Location Number (GLN)
leiCode.description: A Legal Entity Identifier of the manufacturer issued by GLEIF (required), for more information see https://gleif.org

name.title: Name of the product item
examples: short name of product (required)

description.title: Description of the product item
examples: Description of product (required)

model.title: Model of the product
examples: produdct model name, a URL is also allowed (required)

color.title: Color of the product
examples: color of product -- 'mix' is allowed (required)

material.title: Material the product is made from
examples: Material the product is made from, could be specified as 'composites' (required)

weight.title: Weight of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (kg) (required)

height.title: Height of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (meter) (required)

width.title: Width of the product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (meter) (required)

depth.title: Depth of the Product
examples: floating point metric system value plus unit measure (meter) (required)

url.title: Url or the product item
examples: URL of the product; could be empty (required)

isBasedOn.title: Is based on
examples: URI for the resource, e.g., patent, from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption; could be empty (required)

image.title: Image of the product
examples: encoded picture of the product as a URI/URL (required)
